overview: From 2025-09-10 to 2025-09-11, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 7 new PRs (6 merged), 1 new issues, and 30 active contributors.

topIssues.title: kurtosis idempotency / performance
topIssues.author: sigma
topIssues.body:
This is an umbrella issue / high-level plan to get to a better state for kurtosis devnet experience.
 

1. issue: contracts bundle not reproducible (PR: #14365 )
    - tweak tarball to be bit-reproducible
    - put it in predictable location so kurtosis sees it as identical (kurtosis issue workaround)

2. issue: docker images not reproducible enough
   - make sure we disable attestations for dev builds (#14410)
   - uniquely identify images (kurtosis doesn't moving tags well) (#14411) 

3. issue: docker images are still slow to (re-)build (#14409)
    - make sure we dockerignore everything we can, so that nop-builds are as fast as possible (context transfer is costly)

4. issue: flip/flopping between packages (fileserver / optimism-package) in an enclave ruins idempotency
    - avoid re-running fileserver when artifacts are identical (#14413)
    - move contracts bundle into enclave artifact
        - wrapper needs to create it (note: from the outside we can’t mutate an artifact, so use “contracts-$HASH”) (#14932)
        - teach optimism-package to understand “enclave://contracts-$HASH” (ethpandaops/optimism-package#203)
            - add to list of mounts for op-deployer
            - leverage op-deployer file locator to point to the mount

5. issue: changes in proofs still churns too much
    - integrate nginx server into optimism-package to cache-proxy locator by default (well, at least proxy so the URL is predictable, but a cache would be nice to make the whole system more self-contained)
    - make nginx image tunable
    - make wrapper build custom nginx, embedding proofs
        - reason: most of the “build” time is spent extracting the proofs locally from a docker image, only to put them in another. We can avoid the roundtrip by creating an  nginx container pre-populated from  the proofs build
        - adjust nginx config to  serve these proofs on a non-proxied URL
    - tie that nginx server to the deployment of op-challenger

6. Issue: embedding the devnet descriptor breaks idempotency (#14412)
    - purely a bug in the wrapper, re-generating a descriptor in-place fails

Final outcome (hopefully !):

- proper incremental builds, leveraging kurtosis known dependency graph
- docker images are bit-reproducible, so idempotent builds don’t trigger enclave churn
- proofs build is as fast as possible (in the order of seconds, not minutes), and doesn’t trigger enclave churn beyond fileserver redeployment
- only one package run in the devnet enclave, which makes kurtosis’ job tracking changes easier

topIssues.title: kurtosis-devnet: extract / map L1 chain config
topIssues.author: sigma
topIssues.body: See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/14996 for context and current workaround

topIssues.title: kurtosis-devnet: add rotatory welcome message
topIssues.author: serpixel
topIssues.body:
Add a rotatory welcome message (disabled with a flag / a file placeholder) that tells users about the newest features available on kurtosis devnet.

The background behind this is that oftentimes we have new features developed but there's no external visibility of these, by publishing a message at the beginning people should be able to use the new features.

topIssues.title: [kurtosis-devnet] investigate selective service selection
topIssues.author: serpixel
topIssues.body:
We want to enable users to selectively start services. This would enable us to, for example, start services using the op-signer but also start them without.
We should see if we can create a dependency graph for a specific configuration

topIssues.title: [kurtosis-devnet] create tests for proxyd
topIssues.author: serpixel
topIssues.body:
The optimism-package repository is lacking a lot of tests, which makes it potentially a liability.
Tracked [here](https://github.com/ethpandaops/optimism-package/pull/232)

topPRs.title: Introduce BlockBuilder in op-node engine package

topPRs.title: jovian: add acceptance test for the da footprint limit
topPRs.author: joshklop

topPRs.title: fix(op-deployer): EnsureDefaultCacheDir
topPRs.author: bitwiseguy
topPRs.body: Fixes a bug: previously if the default cache dir didn't exist, downstream code would fail

topPRs.title: circleci: enable OPM and Base mainnet op-node sync tests (nightly)
topPRs.author: nonsense
topPRs.body:
This PR is adding `OPM` and `Base` to the CircleCI configuration, so that we sync op-node with them during the nightly CI job.

Also add a Slack notification if any of `op-acceptance-sync-tests-docker` runs fail.

completedItems.title: op-dispute-mon: Support cannon-kona games

completedItems.title: circleci: enable OPM and Base mainnet op-node sync tests (nightly)
completedItems.body:
This PR is adding `OPM` and `Base` to the CircleCI configuration, so that we sync op-node with them during the nightly CI job.

Also add a Slack notification if any of `op-acceptance-sync-tests-docker` runs fail.

completedItems.title: ci: Add a stand alone check for solc warnings
completedItems.body:
For some unknown amount of time we have not been checking for `solc` warnings in solidity test files.

This PR adds the check warnings as a standalone `contracts-bedrock-checks` step, and removes the warnings check from other build steps

completedItems.title: op-up: update default version in install script
